article_title: Editorial: Beware of health insurance mega-mergers
article_text:
01:12 Valley's Trump supporters talk about their candidate Pause

00:33 Patriotic colors fly in Trump rally line

00:19 Trump protesters: 'Donald Trump has got to go'

01:08 Trump protesters enter war of words with Trump supporters

01:17 Trump's pro, con sides clash at church

00:27 Trump supporters rally for their candidate in Fresno

01:06 Trump protesters: 'Keep hate out of our state'

01:01 'We're not going to spare any resources,' Fresno police Chief Dyer says before Trump rally

01:05 'We want our president to be Donald Trump,' say the first in line at Fresno rally

02:29 Sunnyside students in Fresno discuss the 'Trump effect'

article_metadata.news-keywords: Anthem, Aetna, Humana, Cigna, United Healthgroup, Affordable Care Act, baby boomers, premiums, Medicare, merger, California, editorial
article_metadata.description: At last count, about 1 in 10 Americans lacked health insurance, a rate that has been halved in a handful of years. Not long ago, millions of people were one serious illness or pre-existing condition away from the poorhouse. This is major progress, and so far, it has happened without the soaring premiums and elimination of choice predicted by opponents of the Affordable Care Act.
article_metadata.title: Editorial: Beware of health insurance mega-mergers | Fresno Bee
